clip_assessment.why_this_stops_scrolls: It reframes client relationships from transactional to sacred â€” and reveals why top producers never complain about 'difficult' clients.

HOOK.text: The agents doing $50 million a year don't have difficult clients.
HOOK.production_note: Bold text overlay on black background. Cut to Kristee mid-sentence, serious expression.

SETUP.text: Kristee Leonard moves over $50 million in luxury real estate in Austin every single year. And when I asked her about client management, she said something that stopped me cold.
SETUP.production_note: B-roll of luxury Austin properties. Quick cuts. Upbeat but focused energy.

INSIGHT.text: She said: 'It's an honor to be chosen by clients, and I treat them like they're an honor.' Not 'I tolerate them.' Not 'I manage expectations.' She sees being chosen as a privilege. So when a client texts at 9 PM? That's not an interruption â€” that's someone who trusted her with the biggest financial decision of their life. When someone asks to see a property three times? That's not annoying â€” that's someone making sure they get it right. The reframe is everything.
INSIGHT.production_note: Show Kristee speaking the quote on screen. Then cut to text overlays of the reframes ('9 PM text = privilege' / 'Third showing = diligence'). Use split-screen to contrast attitudes.

REFRAME.text: Here's what changes: When you treat being chosen as an honor, you stop resenting the work. You stop complaining about clients. And they feel it. That energy is the difference between a transaction and a referral machine.
REFRAME.production_note: Slow zoom on Kristee's face. Overlay text: 'They feel it.' Cut to testimonial-style footage or 5-star reviews.

CTA.text: So ask yourself: Do your clients feel like an honor to work with? Or do they feel like they're bothering you? That answer is your business in 12 months.
